summary: Initial release of Trust documentation establishing core principles and commitments.

sections.title: Core Trust Principles
lines: Trust is preparation, not observation.
We do not track buyer behavior with Trust Bundles.
We do not link token access to buyer identity.
We do not use engagement data to inform pricing or commercial decisions.
All trust content is versioned, immutable, and publicly auditable.

sections.title: Data Collection Statement
lines: Trust Bundles use bearer tokens that do not require authentication.
No personally identifiable information (PII) is collected during bundle access.
Aggregate telemetry is collected for product improvement only.
Individual access patterns are not stored, analyzed, or shared.
Rate limiting counters exist for abuse prevention but are not exposed.

sections.title: Customer Rights
lines: Customers have the right to access Trust Bundles without surveillance.
Customers have the right to view this changelog and all historical versions.
Customers have the right to verify our claims through independent audit.
Customers have the right to revoke bundle access at any time.
Customers have the right to request attestation reports.

sections.title: Our Commitments
lines: We commit to transparent versioning of all trust documentation.
We commit to public changelog with customer-safe explanations.
We commit to no silent changes to trust content.
We commit to rollback capability for any trust version.
We commit to full audit logging of trust operations.

sections.title: Trust Governance
lines: Trust content changes require explicit version bumps.
Major changes are reviewed by Trust Architecture Authority.
All changes are logged with author, timestamp, and reason.
Historical versions are never deleted.
Deploy gates prevent trust content drift.
